text: Hey team, we need to start thinking about the chat backup feature for the app.
Good point <@U1234>. Should we support *cloud storage* integration?
I think **Google Drive** and **Dropbox** would be good options for now. Maybe we should discuss this in <#C123ABC>?
We should also consider local storage backup for users who prefer that.
Agreed! I’ll start drafting the API for cloud and local backup options.
I'll work on the UI for selecting backup destinations. We need a seamless experience here.
Should we also notify users when a backup is complete or failed?
Yes, a notification system for success and failure is a must. I'll handle that.
We should make use of the same notification framework as the other app features to keep things consistent.
I'll update the UI mockups to include a notification icon for backup status.
What about encryption? We should ensure all backups are encrypted.
Good call. I’ll use AES-256 for local backups and integrate cloud services’ encryption for cloud backups.
I can update the docs to reflect the encryption standards for the backups.
Thanks, <@U3456>! Also, how should we handle large backups? Should we split them?
Yes, for anything over 100MB, we should split and upload in chunks. I’ll work on the logic for that.
I’ll add error handling in case a chunk fails during upload.
We also need to think about supporting automatic periodic backups. Maybe let users set a schedule?
A simple daily, weekly, and monthly option should work. We can add custom intervals later.
I'll implement a cron job system for scheduling the backups.
Make sure users can toggle automatic backups off if they don’t want it.
We should also give users a way to *manually* trigger a backup anytime.
I'll add a 'Backup Now' button to the settings page. That should cover it.
Testing on my side is going well. I’ve tried several scenarios with the cloud backups, and so far no issues.
Same here with the local backups. I’ve tested both encryption and chunking. Looks good.
Great! Let’s start documenting the backup feature so we can prepare the release notes.
I’m on it. I’ll start drafting the user guide and technical documentation.
Should we have a small FAQ section in the docs too?
Yes, definitely. We can include common questions like 'how to restore backups' and 'how to check backup status'.
I’ll also add some UI tips for the FAQ, like where to find the backup logs.
Thanks, everyone! Let’s aim to finish the documentation by the end of the week.
**Reminder:** Next Thursday is the deadline for the backup feature. Don't forget to submit your work!
Hey team, just a question about the backup feature. What happens if a user deletes a conversation? Does it get backed up too?
**Reminder:** Next Thursday is the deadline for the backup feature. Don't forget to submit your work!
I've created a wiki page to document the backup feature. You can find it here <https://ourteam.slack.com/wiki/Backup-Feature>
Nice work @Bob! I've added some details to the wiki page. Let me know if you'd like me to add anything else.
**Deadline reminder:** Next Thursday is the last day to submit your work on the backup feature. Don't forget!
Hey team, I've created a wiki page to document the backup feature. You can find it here <https://ourteam.slack.com/wiki/Backup-Feature>
